rules: Rule1: If the director hires the lead actor, then the film project is successful.
Rule2: Provided that the location scout finds the waterfall, the location manager secures the forest location.
Rule3: Either the location scout finds the waterfall, or the location manager locates the river site.
Rule4: Whenever the location manager locates the river site, then if the cinematographer achieves the lighting setup, the cinematographer finishes the filming.
Rule5: If the production manager schedules the premiere event, then it is not the case that the producer cancels the film project.
Rule6: In the event that the theater owner books the premiere, the venue manager reserves the screening.
Rule7: If the venue manager reserves the screening, then the distributor does not postpone the release.
Rule8: Given that the film premiere is successful, the film project is successful.
Rule9: If the producer approves the script, then the producer changes the script.
Rule10: Either the producer approves the script, or the director hires the lead actor.
Rule11: In the event that the film attracts a large audience, the box office is profitable.
Rule12: Either the film attracts a large audience, or the film receives critical acclaim.
Rule13: Should the film receive critical acclaim, the film wins awards.
Rule14: If the film wins awards, then the film is nominated for Oscars.
Rule15: Whenever the film wins awards, the film is praised by critics.
Rule16: If the studio celebrates the success, then if the film is nominated for Oscars, the film premiere is successful.
Rule17: Given that the sponsor pulls the support, the investor withdraws the funding.
Rule18: If the production extends the timeline, then it is not the case that the production delays the schedule.
Rule19: Should the director conflict with the producer, then the director agrees with the producer.
Rule20: Provided that the director conflicts with the producer, it is not the case that the director agrees with the producer.
Rule21: Either the director conflicts with the producer, or the film crew completes the shooting.
Rule22: In the event that the venue calls off the event, the event planner cancels the party.
Rule23: Either the producer attends the location scouting, or if the producer approves the script, then it is not the case that the producer changes the script.
Rule24: Either the film is featured in festivals, or the film is screened in competitions.
Rule25: Provided that the film is screened in competitions, then if the film is praised by critics, the film premiere is successful.
Rule26: Should the film be selected for Cannes, then if the film is featured in festivals, then if the film is praised by critics, the film premiere is successful.
Rule27: Either the film is selected for Cannes, or the film is chosen for Sundance.
Rule28: If the film is chosen for Sundance, then if the film is featured in festivals, then if the film is praised by critics, the film premiere is successful.
Rule29: In the event that the premiere is attended by celebrities, the film premiere is successful.
Rule30: Given that the press is present at the premiere, the film premiere is successful.
Rule31: Whenever the publicist invites the actors, the premiere is attended by celebrities.
Rule32: Either the publicist invites the actors, or the agent brings the clients.
Rule33: If the agent brings the clients, then the press is present at the premiere.
Rule34: Provided that the film crew completes the shooting, the film project is successful.
Rule35: In the event that the cinematographer finishes the filming, the film crew completes the shooting.
Rule36: Should the camera operator wrap the shooting, the film crew completes the shooting.
Rule37: Either the cinematographer achieves the lighting setup, or the camera operator accomplishes the shot list.
Rule38: Provided that the camera operator accomplishes the shot list, the camera operator wraps the shooting.

Rule39: If it is not the case that either the location manager secures the forest location or if the cinematographer achieves the lighting setup then the cinematographer finishes the filming, then the production delays the schedule.
Rule40: If it is not the case that if the theater owner books the premiere then the distributor does not postpone the release, then the insurance cancels the coverage.
Rule41: In the event that it is not the case that if the producer approves the script then the investor funds the project, the sponsor pulls the support.
Rule42: If it is not the case that either the insurance covers the production or it is not the case that the insurance cancels the coverage, then the insurer denies the claim.

Rule43: Should it not be the case that either the insurance covers the production or it is not the case that the insurance cancels the coverage, then it is not the case that the insurer denies the claim.
Rule44: If it is not the case that if the event planner plans the after party then the production manager schedules the premiere event, then the venue calls off the event.

Rule45: In the event that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the location manager secures the forest location or if the cinematographer achieves the lighting setup then the cinematographer finishes the filming then the production extends the timeline, the budget overruns the estimate.
Rule46: Should it not be the case that the production manager schedules the premiere event, then the distributor postpones the release.
Rule47: If it is not the case that the production manager schedules the premiere event, then the theater owner books the premiere.
Rule48: Whenever it is not the case that the film project is successful, the producer cancels the film project.
facts: Fact1: The studio celebrates the success.
Fact2: The event planner plans the after party.
Fact3: It is not the case that the location manager secures the forest location.
Fact4: It is not the case that the box office is profitable.
Fact5: It is not the case that the investor funds the project.
Fact6: It is not the case that the investor withdraws the funding.
Fact7: It is not the case that the budget overruns the estimate.
Fact8: It is not the case that the insurance covers the production.
Fact9: It is not the case that the event planner cancels the party.
Fact10: It is not the case that the producer attends the location scouting.
